intro: Trema guineense var. asperatum, commonly known as the rough-leaf trema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rough, textured leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous small seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
